Key Arguments: Everyone should be entitled to their opinion and express it freely without fear of retribution.
Government censorship of people's views is inappropriate in a democratic country.
The proposed fines are excessively large and will deter free commentary.
The legislation will end debate and allow only one side of the story to be told.
ACMA should not be the arbitrator of truth in a free society.
What is considered misinformation or disinformation can change over time.
The bill represents censorship and threatens freedom of expression.
Main Themes: Evolving nature of truth and information
Notable Quotes: There should be no government censorship of peoples' views in a democratic country.
One group of people, chosen by the Government (ACMA) cannot be the arbitrator of truth in a free and democratic society.
This bill is about censorship and that is never okay.
